current.summer_note: SUMMER NOTE: During warm weather this item will include an upcharge (for more details, please click on the individual product page). Due to its delicate nature, the product will be wrapped in heat-protective packaging. This product may soften or liquify during shipping. As soon as you get your hands on your Osmia package, let the product cool (upright) at room temperature. Stir if needed and enjoy! We highly recommend choosing Express Shipping if your order includes this product. We apologize but we cannot accept returns on this item. We cannot ship this product internationally or to Hawaii and Alaska from May through September.

settings.message_text: Free Standard Shipping for Orders of $99+ | Free International Shipping for Orders of $350+

settings.title: How do I use the Black Clay Facial Soap?
settings.text: Our Black Clay Soap should be used like any other bar of soap: wet your face and hands, create a nice lather by rubbing your hands together with the soap between your two palms, then use your fingers to wash your face gently for 15-30 seconds. Give special attention to areas that tend to become congested, like the sides of the nose, the hairline, and the chin. Rinse copiously with lukewarm water, pat dry with a towel.

settings.title: How do I use Spotless Blemish Oil?
settings.text: This is a very concentrated essential oil blend, formulated to be applied to blemishes 3-5 times a day. Use this product as the last layer in your skincare routine, on top of all other products, and keep it away from your eyes. (If applied under another product, it could get spread over the entire face.) Do not apply this serum to the entire face - only to blemishes!

settings.title: How do I use the Osmia facial masks?
settings.text: Each of our masks can be used two ways - as a facial scrub, or as a leave-on mask. Start by cleansing your skin and hands. Then, combine two spoonfuls of mask with just enough warm water to make a smooth paste in a bowl (add the water slowly). Gently spread the paste over your clean face and neck. If you’re only exfoliating, work the mask in circles using the mildest possible pressure, for about a minute. Step into the shower and rinse clean. If you’re masking, leave the product on your skin for 10-15 minutes, pressing it with wet hands or spritzing with thermal water to moisten if it starts to get tight. When you’re ready, step into the shower and use gentle circular motions with the fingertips while rinsing away the mask. Still have questions? Watch our Detox and Adzuki videos!

settings.title: How do I store my soap between uses?
settings.text: We recommend keeping your handmade, organic soap on a soap saver, safely out of the water in the soap dish. A soap saver allows the soap to dry on all sides, so your soap will last much longer, and you won’t have soupy soap in the meantime. On the road? Try our soap travel bag, a convenient way to keep your favorite soap handy and safe when you’re far from home.

settings.title: What products are safe to use during pregnancy?
settings.text: Take a look at our blog post on this topic, written by our founder, Dr. Sarah Villafranco. The use of essential oils in pregnancy is a personal decision, and one you should make with your healthcare provider. For quick reference, though, here is our Pregnancy Product Guide.
settings.button_text: READ OUR BLOG POST TO LEARN MORE

settings.title: What is the expiration date of my product?
settings.text:
We recommend using our products by the "Best By" date which can be found on the bottom of the box and/or container in a BBMMDDYY format. This means that even if it has not been opened, it still needs to be used within that time period. 

Email us with any questions!

settings.title: Are there ingredients you won't use in your products?
settings.text: Yep. Tons.
settings.button_text: READ OUR BLOG POST TO LEARN WHAT WE WON'T USE

settings.title: Are Osmia products Vegan and Cruelty Free?
settings.text:
All Osmia products are cruelty-free, and the only animals we use for testing are ourselves! Most of our products are vegan, with a few exceptions listed below. We use a bunny logo on each product page of our website to show which items are ‘cruelty-free and vegan’ and which are just ‘cruelty-free’. The same bunny appears on the product packaging, so find it there, as well.

Here is a list of our cruelty-free, non-vegan products:
- Detox Exfoliating Mask (contains honey)
- Serenity Milk Bath (contains milk powder)
- Lip Doctor (contains beeswax)
- Lip Repair (contains lanolin, honey, & beeswax)
- Pumpkin Facial Soap (honey)
- Lavender Pine Soap (buttermilk powder)
- Milky Rose Soap (buttermilk powder)
- Oh So Soap (buttermilk powder)

settings.title: Are your products 100% organic?
settings.text: Nope. Our products contain natural and organic ingredients, and don’t contain any of these things, but we are not a certified organic company. The National Organic Program of the USDA, which provides the standards for organic certification, publishes the National List of Allowed Substances for Non-Agricultural Ingredients. Since this list is based on materials used in agriculture or food production, many of our favorite beneficial skincare ingredients are not mentioned. On each product page and label, we let you know the percent of certified organic ingredients in that product. Our priority is purchasing the highest quality ingredients from the highest quality suppliers, grown organically or wild-harvested whenever possible. Some of our suppliers have not achieved organic certification yet, so we can’t list their ingredients, even when organically grown and processed, as certified organic. We’d rather have it that way than using a certified organic ingredient that smells worse and comes from a company we don’t know and trust. If you have any questions, you can email us any time!

settings.title: Do you use gluten in your products?
settings.text: We do not use any gluten-containing ingredients, but we are not a certified gluten-free facility. We use certified gluten-free oats in some of our bath and body products. We also use a liquid oat extract, which is not a certified gluten-free ingredient, in our Active Gel Toner.

settings.title: Do you use soy in your products?
settings.text: Our Vitamin E oil consists of mixed tocopherols from non-GMO soy sources. We use this oil, in combination with an organic rosemary extract, as an antioxidant in many of our soaps and some of our oil products. It is listed in the ingredients in every product in which we use it.

settings.title: Do you have any products with sunscreen?
settings.text: We do not currently carry any products with sunscreen.
settings.button_text: READ OUR ARTICLE FOR SUNSCREEN SUGGESTIONS

settings.title: Can I use a Vitamin C Serum with your facial products?
settings.text: We’d prefer that you not use a Vitamin C Serum with any of our products that contain sodium benzoate (a natural preservative in our Active Gel Toner and Purely Simple Face Cream. When sodium benzoate is mixed with vitamin C, it can undergo changes that make it less safe than it is in our products, where it is not used with vitamin C.

settings.title: What do you recommend for perioral dermatitis?
settings.text: We recommend the products in our Soothing Starter Set, and suggest that you order 1-2 sample sized kits to get started. When you have dermatitis, it’s always good to make sure the products agree with your skin before you purchase the full sizes.
settings.button_text: READ OUR BLOG TO LEARN MORE ABOUT PD

settings.title: What do you recommend for acne-prone skin?
settings.text: We have a great blog post about natural acne management, complete with education and lifestyle recommendations. For skin care, we recommend our Balancing Starter Set.
settings.button_text: READ OUR "TREAT ACNE NATURALLY" BLOG POST

settings.title: What do you recommend for rosacea?
settings.text: Our Rose Clay Facial Soap, Restore Facial Serum, Purely Simple Face Cream, and Nectar Vital Rose Drops are our favorite products for rosacea. They all contain essential oils that have a toning effect on the small blood vessels that are inflamed in rosacea. They can be used in combination with dermatological prescriptions for rosacea.

settings.title: When can I expect my order to arrive?
settings.text:
Please allow 7-14 days for standard order processing, as we are taking extra precautions producing and packaging our products to keep everyone safe. Once your order has shipped, you will receive a confirmation email from us with your tracking information.

Thank you for shopping with us!

settings.title: What if I want my purchase in a gift box?
settings.text:
The Osmia team will combine your entire order so it fits in one beautiful gift box if you have chosen "add a gift box" at checkout. If you need more than one gift box, please purchase a separate gift box ($8 each), for each additional gift. If you need further assistance, please email help@osmiaorganics.com, and we will do our best to accommodate you. 

CLICK HERE TO SEE OUR GIFT BOXES

settings.title: Why was I charged a customs tax in addition to the shipping I already paid?
settings.text: Unfortunately, we do not have any control over this, as every country sets its own customs charges for packages entering from international destinations. The customs charge seems to range from 5-50% of the value of your order, due upon delivery of your package. We do not provide refunds for customs charges, so be sure to research them before you place an international order.

settings.title: What if I don’t like my product or feel that it isn’t working for me?
settings.text: Email us at info@osmiaorganics.com! We want to make sure you’re using the products correctly, and that you’ve had every chance to bond with your Osmia goodies. But we also want happy customers, so please let us know what’s going on, and we will try to make you just that - happy!

settings.title: How do I subscribe or unsubscribe to your newsletter?
settings.text:
Good question.

To subscribe to our newsletter please click on the link below. Click SUBSCRIBE TO LIST and you're set! Welcome! 

If you'd like to sadly unsubscribe to our newsletter, please go to your email, open any of our newsletters, scroll to the bottom and click UNSUBSCRIBE FROM THIS LIST. We're sad to see you go!

settings.title: Are the trees I planted within my order tax deductible?
settings.text: Unfortunately, they are not. If you are looking to plant trees and write them off on your taxes, please visit the One Tree Planted website directly.

settings.title: How do I become a wholesaler of Osmia Organics?
settings.text: Please email us at info@osmiaorganics.com!

settings.title: I am a blogger and want to review Osmia Organics, how do I go about requesting product?
settings.text: You can email us at info@osmiaorganics.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible! We love working with bloggers, but have a limited budget for doing so - we will work you into the schedule when we can, and appreciate all you’re doing to spread the word about natural beauty!

settings.title: Black Clay Facial Soap
settings.text:
"My face has never looked this good after using a face wash. And after dealing with perioral dermatitis for the past two years, I am super cautious of what I put on my skin. I rarely switch up my routine, but I am so glad I did. This is better than anything I've used that's targeted towards treating PD. Will certainly purchase again."

- Jailynn

settings.title: Purely Simple Face Cream
settings.text:
"The Purely Simple Face Cream has become my go-to. It's not heavy, and you only need a little bit so it lasts. The smell is subtle, but very nice. My redness has already decreased tremendously. My entire bathroom shelf and shower has become all Osmia and it hasn't let me down!"

- Anna

settings.title: Lip Doctor
settings.text:
"I've tried everything and Lip Doctor works better than anything I've used. First time in years that I've had "normal" non-peeling, dry, chapped lips. I'm amazed by how well it works—I won't go without this product!"

- Kat

settings.title: We will never ever, ever...
settings.text: ever, ever, ever, use synthetic color, synthetic fragrance, ethoxylated ingredients, petroleum products, phthalates, parabens, or sulfates.

settings.title: Not Your Average Blog — We Promise.

settings.title: Image with text overlay
settings.text: Use overlay text to give your customers insight into your brand. Select imagery and text that relates to your style and story.

settings.title: What We Won't Use
settings.text: Look for the "tox screen" on our boxes. It's a list of ingredients that do not end up in ANY Osmia products - ever. Want to know WHY we have a long list of ingredients we won't use? Check out this blog post!

settings.disclaimner: Osmia does not make any claims to treat or cure acne, perioral dermatitis, or any other skin condition with this or any of their products. All reviews reflect the personal views of our customers, and do not imply or represent any claims by Osmia. Individual results may vary.

settings.title: OUR STORY
settings.text: In 2012, Dr. Sarah Villafranco redirected her career in emergency medicine to start Osmia, which she sees as a new brand of wellness for your skin, your senses, and the earth.

settings.title: OUR MISSION
settings.text: Osmia energizes people to engage in their own wellness through skin health and sensory experience.

settings.title: WHAT WE USE & WHAT WE WON'T
settings.text:
Using an only-the-essentials approach to optimal skin health, Osmia products are made with the highest quality natural ingredients—always consciously-sourced, and organic whenever possible.

All Osmia products are made WITHOUT the following ingredients: parabens, phthalates, sulfates, petrochemicals, ethoxylated ingredients, synthetic color, and synthetic fragrance.

settings.title: PHILOSOPHY
settings.text:
RETURN TO YOUR SENSES:
Engage your senses in even the tiniest moments of your life.

RECLAIM YOUR POWER:
Embrace the privilege to be proactive in your health.

REDEFINE YOUR BEAUTY:
Endeavor to love yourself at every stage of life.

settings.title: LOCATION
settings.text:
Why Carbondale, CO?
Because… mountains.

settings.title: WHAT WE USE
settings.text:
Osmia Organics begins with the most beautiful, consciously-sourced plant materials we can find, even if they are more expensive. We are not a certified organic company at this time, but if an ingredient is available in certified organic form, that is how we will use it. All of our certified organic ingredients are indicated with an asterisk in the list of ingredients on each product page and our packaging. We don’t list our essential oil blends (we think they’re kinda special and want to keep them that way) but feel free to email us if you have sensitivities and need to know about specific oils.

After we’ve obsessed about the ingredients, we formulate by combining them for maximum efficacy, with strict, quality control. We then package the products in the most environmentally aware packaging suitable for each product, and ship them to you in recycled cardboard boxes with paper tape. Want to know more about the ways in which we strive to be the most mindful company on the block?

settings.customer_signature: Signature required is not available for international customers
settings.title: Add Signature Required Shipping Option
settings.description: If you sometimes have trouble receiving packages, we recommend that you add this service to your order to ensure that a signature is required for delivery. We want to be certain that your lovely-scented Osmia order ends up in your hands!
settings.description_gift: The Osmia team will combine your entire order so it fits in one beautiful gift box. If you need more than one, please purchase a separate "gift box" for each gift. For each request, please detail your request below or email help@osmiaorganics.com and we will do our best to accommodate you!

settings.bio_detail:
WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Special Soaps! Because they are all beautiful and I look forward to trying something new each season.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
I love having a home spa day with the Himalayan Body Buff and Detox Mask.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
In the winter, I use our Body Oil on the ends of my washed wet hair to prevent static.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
I'm inspired by preforming and visual art, which we have an abundance of in the valley. I also love ecstatic dance parties and sound healings.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
I’ve been a long time fan of Osmia’s bar soap; since 2014?, well before crafting the soaps! My go-to bars of this season are Onsen, Pumpkin Facial (as a luxurious body bar), and Oh So.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
My routine is quite simple- Lip Doctor and bar soap are daily essentials. Mud Cleanser on the Konjac Sponge a few times a week or at the very least, Friday after work! The Nectar Vital Rose Drops level up any face cream/body lotion/ etc etc etc.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 

1. Cut all soap bars into three even sized pieces; the soap lasts longer this way and the added benefit is that you can rotate through soaps without being committed to the same one for as long. A soap saver is essential!

2. Pumpkin Facial as a body soap= luxury! So rich and moisturizing, I love using this face soap as a body soap.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
I spend as much time as possible exploring locally, statewide, and internationally, by bike. You can find me here on Carbondale trails on my lunch break or anywhere in the West come the weekend. I also enjoy time with my toy poodle Zeppelin, baking, and everything coffee!

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Lip Doctor - it's good for everything!

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Black Clay Facial Soap morning and evening, follow with Purely Simple Face Cream, Spotless as needed, Light Body Oil after showering and Detox Exfoliating Mask once a week. Lip Doctor ten times a day.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
Sometimes I put Lip Repair (or in a pinch Lip Doctor) on a blister that's starting to form when running, skiing, etc.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Hanging out with my family, running, gardening, skiing, and design.

settings.bio_designation: WATER BODY OIL & HIMALAYAN BODY BUFF
settings.bio_detail:
WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Water Body Oil - Makes me feel grounded and charged for the day, Himalayan Body Buff - My skin and soul feel like they went to the spa after using it.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Face: Black Clay, Purely Simple and Nectar.

Body: Osmia soap and always a body oil after the shower ( I have quite the collection). 

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
Spotless for bug bites, Naked Mousse and Oil for a hair treatment. 

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Going to shows, museums, yoga, camping, anything food or travel related (literally anything) my plants, and of course binging Netflix.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?Nectar, Lip Doctor and Lip Repair - so crucial in our dry climate. They're all multi-functional and work so well - Lip Repair for chapped lips, nose, and even dry fingertips, and Nectar mixed with almost anything, including under the eyes overnight sealed in with some Lip Doctor (one of my favorite tips from our founder!)

WHAT IS YOUSR OSMIA ROUTINE?
I'm turning 40 this month, and the Mature/Dry Skin Kits (plus Nectar!) are a must for me. Coffee Mint Soap, Lavender Shea Soap, and Night Body Oil are my favorite daily body products, with Himalayan Body Buff and masks sprinkled in on the weekends.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS?
Check out my favorite products above - and also Restore Facial Serum is amazing for anywhere you've gotten a little too much sun :)

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)?
I love to spend time hiking with my little boy and running or riding the Rio Grande trail - the opportunities to explore here are endless!

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Rosemary Body Mousse because of its scent! It is so soothing especially after being out in the sun!

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Rose Clay Facial Soap, Purely Simple, facial serum when needed. Body soap in the shower followed by body oil. Body mousse when extra moisturizing is needed.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
Naked Body Mousse to style my hair!

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Being outdoors, snowboarding, spending quality time with my family, traveling.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Without a doubt my favorite product is Himalayan Body Buff! Having been born without a sense of smell, I favor products that are more tactile. It is a blissful, exfoliating treat that sloughs away dry, dead skin and leaves behind touchable, silky skin. I'm obsessed.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Let's talk showers! I use my soap du jour (anyone who is able to have one Osmia soap at a time...how?) and try to match it to what my skin needs--Coffee Mint after a work out, Oh So Soap for those dry days, or Lavender Pine for extra scrub. Once the water is off, I'm reaching for Naked Body Oil to lock in the moisture and ensure soft skin. About once a week, 5-10 minutes prior to my shower, I'll mix up an Adzuki Nourishing Face Mask (always with honey) and exfoliate my body with Himalayan Body Buff after cleansing with soap.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
Use Himalayan Body Buff on your legs right before shaving for a closer, smoother shave.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Outside of Osmia, my passion lies in living an adventurous life. And that can take form in multiple ways, so I feel like I'm cheating by saying living is my passion, but let me explain. From transporting my imagination to far off places through reading and writing to SCUBA diving, ice climbing, and embarking on camping trips in the desert complete with repelling down waterfalls inside a canyon, I treasure having the ability to experience new things and appreciate the world. I think I'll try anything at least once, even if I'm terrified, and trust me, half the time I am.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
It feels like a herculean task to narrow down my favorite products, but I've really been loving our Palo Santo Soap lately. The sweetly grounding scent of this soap helps me to recenter and slow down when the world seems to be spinning too fast.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
My tried and true routine is washing with Black Clay Facial Soap, applying Balance Facial Serum mixed with a few drops of Nectar to damp skin, doing some breathing exercises to enjoy the smell of my own face (totally normal Osmia protocol really), and, finally, applying Spotless Blemish Oil to any bumps or blemishes popping up at the moment. Once a week I'll incorporate our Detox Exfoliating Mask and every now and then I'll throw in a raw honey mask in the evening.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
Spring is just peaking her buds and blooms from the Earth here in Colorado and our lovely bees are out in full force with her. I somehow got stung behind my ear and applying a dab of Spotless Blemish Oil to the area helped calm the immediate burning and irritation.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
I dabble in watercolor painting, essay writing, and fiber arts in my downtime. The landscape and individuals here in Carbondale provide ample inspiration for me to explore new ideas and projects.

settings.bio_designation: PRIMA SPRING SOAP & HIMALAYAN BODY BUFF
settings.bio_detail:
WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Right now I am loving the whole body routine. Prima Body Soap, Himalayan Body Buff 2-3x per week, and then finishing every shower with the Night Body Oil and Naked Mousse. It makes my skin so soft and shiny in these incredibly dry Colorado seasons!

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Body: Prima Body Soap, Himalayan Salt Body Buff 2-3x per week, and then after every shower I use the Night Body Oil and Naked Mousse.

Face: Black Clay Facial Soap in the shower, a mixture of the Purely Simple Face Cream and Nectar Vital Rose Drops and then Lip Doctor to top it off.

ALWAYS using the Linden Rose Hand Cream throughout the day!


DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
I put the Nectar Vital Rose Drops under my eyes for some extra moisture.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
You can always find me outside with my dog when I am not at work; whether it is by the river, on the rio or hiking a trail. I love to cook especially when you can use all the wonderful seasonal produce from our local farms.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
If I'm being practical, the Black Clay hands down, It's done wonders for my PD. I've actually been able to heal it naturally instead of going on antibiotics for the first time since I developed this pesky rash! If I'm just picking one (or two) for pleasure, I'd definitely go with either the Lavender Body Mousse or Night Body Oil. They are super soothing before bed.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Since my PD is currently flaring up, I stick to Black Clay and Purely Simple on my face. For my body, I use Oh So Soap (or Detox) and follow that with Naked Body Mousse mixed with Night Body Oil!

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
My cuticles get painfully dry in the winter. If I apply some Lip Repair to them before bed, they are MUCH better in the morning.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
I love outdoor activities! Hiking, fly fishing, camping, anything in water, to name a few. I'm also very passionate about art. My latest projects have been centered around furniture restoration, or revamping home decor I find cheap or already own. I'm also a big fan of movies and books. I love getting caught up in a story.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Brighten Facial Serum—it used to be that I could take or leave facial serums but when Covid shutdowns happened, I started experimenting with my routine and would actually get compliments over zoom about my skin whenever I used Brighten, so I'm a convert. (And I know, what you'll say, "But Annie, what people say doesn't matter, it is how you feel!", but here's what I say: "Compliments feel good, so I want to keep getting them!"). Brighten gives me a sunny complexion, every time. 

Soap Travel Bag - NOTHING else works to transport soap.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Face: Black Clay Facial Soap and Brighten Facial Serum

Body: Vetiver Grey Body Soap (or any soap chip) and I splurged and am using Sacred Rose Craft Series and it is outrageous! I feel so elegant when I use this body oil!

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
I've been playing around with using some of our soaps as shampoo bars and I actually am really impressed! Any of them could work, but I might not recommend Coffee Mint or Lavender Pine unless you want a scalp exfoliation!

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
In the warmer months I love riding my bike on the gravel roads around Carbondale (and often beyond) and experimenting with gardening! In the winter I'll be curled up by the fire or out skiing (cross country, backcountry, tele, alpine, AT, just get me on the snow)!

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
My favorite Osmia products are the Balance Facial Serum and the Purely Gentle Mud Cleanser. They both smell amazing and work magic on my face.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
My Osmia routine is Lavender Pine in the shower and then Mud or Black Clay to cleanse my face. I follow with a few drops of Balance mixed into my moisturizer.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
I like to let the suds from my Mud or Black Clay linger on my face instead of immediately rinsing. I feel like it works a little extra magic. Also using organic green tea instead of just water mixed into the Detox Exfoliating Face Mask is a game changer!

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Outside of Osmia I love hiking and leisurely bike riding. I also love playing in the river with my dog and napping in the sun. Traveling and exploring new parts of Colorado with my partner, and eating lots of food is always a good time!

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Lip Doctor, because it lives in my jacket pocket, is suitable for all seasons and occasions, and smells like chocolate.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Black Clay Facial Soap morning and evening, followed by Purely Simple Face Cream in the morning and Balance Facial Serum in the evening. Lip Doctor as needed, and occasional mousse for ashy elbows and ankles.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
That soap saver is clutch. Soap can last a really long time.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Word games, books, and puzzles. Also, running, traveling, sleeping, snacking, baking bread, and wrapping dumplings. And spending time with my lovely husband.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Sunset Body Oil is my favorite indulgence. I'm a true fan of all our body oils and cycle through them at different times of the year (I must have them for after a shower or bath!), but Sunset is perfect for any mood, and any time of year for me. 

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
Having Rose Clay Facial Soap, and either Oh So Soap or Oh So Detox Soap on hand at all times is a necessity for me here in the dry Colorado climate with sensitive skin! I'll soak in Recovery Salt Bath if I feel any sign of a cold or sore muscles sneaking up. Lip Repair and Linden Rose Hand Cream are part of my nightly routine without fail.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
If I don't have any Recovery Salt Bath on hand, and feel the need for a restorative soak, I'll add a few drops of Evergreen Special Release or Lavender Mint Special Release Body Oil to my bath water. What a treat!

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Hiking, cooking, art, and spending time with my furry four legged family members all keep me endlessly excited about life outside of Osmia.

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
I love Black Clay Facial Soap, Light Body Oil and the Rosemary Body Mousse. The soap cleans my skin well!  I don't think I've ever had such clean skin!

Light Body Oil has such an amazing scent of Lemongrass and feels so good on my skin.  

The Rosemary Body Mousse was one of the first products I bought because I was so intrigued by rosemary. Once I smelled it, I couldn't believe how incredible the scent was—it couldn't be any more pure if I was smelling a sprig of rosemary. It's so beautiful.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
In the morning, I cleanse my face with Black Clay Facial Soap with a Konjac Sponge (my other favorite thing!). Then I use serum and Purely Simple Face Cream.  On my body, it depends on the mood I'm in. If I shower at night I use Night Body Oil. If I shower in the morning, I'll sometimes use Naked Body Oil mixed with Rosemary Body Mousse or Light Body Oil—ALL so incredible!

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
I just tried our Detox Exfoliating Mask as a scrub. I mixed the powder with some Purely Gentle Mud Cleanser and scrubbed it away. Sarah did something like this on one of her IG posts and I thought it was brilliant.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
My biggest passion is my son, Darden who is almost 13!!  He loves skiing and doing flips on his trampoline. I do love skiing, hiking, skinning, biking, reading, and of course, skin and body health!

WHAT ARE YOUR FAVORITE OSMIA PRODUCTS AND WHY?
Coffee Mint Body Soap, it's just so invigorating and the scent is so fresh.

WHAT IS YOUR OSMIA ROUTINE? 
I just slather Purely Simple Face Cream on as needed.

DO YOU HAVE ANY OSMIA TIPS & TRICKS? 
I start my day with Coffee Mint Soap because its scent wakes me up and gets me ready to start the day.

WHAT ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT OUTSIDE OF OSMIA (HOBBIES, ACTIVITIES, & INTERESTS)? 
Overlanding in my Jeep with my little family. Traveling around the world. Jigsaw puzzles.

settings.text: Please note: Osmia is not responsible and will not pay for additional duties or customs charged by the destination country, therefore, the customs charge is not reflected on our site at the time of checkout.

settings.title: What is natural soap?
settings.text: Osmia soap is made with plant oils and sodium hydroxide, which get mixed together and rearrange into soap molecules and glycerin. It is more nourishing to the skin and the environment than commercial soap.

settings.title: What are the benefits of using natural body soap?
settings.text: Glycerin is a natural by-product of cold-process soapmaking, and remains in the bar, where it draws moisture to your skin throughout the day. It keeps the skin clean and soft, and effectively removes many harmful viruses and bacteria.

settings.title: What is the best natural body soap?
settings.text: Ingredients in Osmia soaps like olive oil, shea butter, sustainably-sourced palm oil, mineral rich clays, and essential oils make all of our bar soaps wonderful to use—look for one that appeals to you. If you’re extremely sensitive, choose an unscented bar like Oh So or Oh So Detox.

settings.title: Is body wash better than body soap?
settings.text: Natural bar soap has fewer ingredients and less packaging than body wash, and is generally less drying to the skin than body wash.

settings.title: What is the best body soap for dry skin?
settings.text: For dry skin, look for a natural soap that contains ingredients like olive oil, shea butter, natural clays, and only essential oils for scent, rather than synthetic fragrance. Avoid any product with sodium lauryl/laureth sulfate. Oh So, Milky Rose, and Lavender Shea are Osmia’s most nourishing bars.

settings.title: What soap do dermatologists recommend?
settings.text: Dermatologists often recommend soaps from companies that provide free samples to their offices, without much consideration for the ingredients. Since many skin conditions involve allergies or inflammation, a soap with fewer, more natural ingredients and no synthetic scent like Oh So Soap is actually a better choice.

settings.title: Can you make soap without chemicals?
settings.text: In order to be called soap, either sodium or potassium hydroxide—both forms of lye—must be used. In a properly made soap, the lye all gets used up in the chemical reaction, and there is none left in the final bar or liquid.

settings.title: What does body oil do?
settings.text: Body oil, when applied to wet skin, seals in moisture and fortifies the protective lipid layer of the skin.

settings.title: Is body oil good for your skin?
settings.text: Body oil is a great choice for all skin types. When applied to wet skin, it helps the skin hold moisture and keeps the top layer of skin soft and nourished.

settings.title: Should I use body oil or lotion?
settings.text: Body oil has fewer ingredients than lotion, and does not require ingredients like emulsifiers and preservatives. In addition, you’re not paying for water, which is the main ingredient in most lotions.

settings.title: Which body oil is best?
settings.text: Choose an Osmia Body Oil based on the product description and your scent preferences. Night is a best seller, and Naked is not scented if you’re looking for a simpler option.

settings.title: What is the best body oil for dry skin?
settings.text: Sunset and Water are especially nourishing to dry skin, but the most important thing is to apply any Osmia Body Oil to sopping wet skin and allow it to air dry for maximum moisture.

settings.title: Which soap is best for your face?
settings.text: Black Clay Facial Soap is our best-selling facial bar, and is suitable for most skin types. Rose Clay Facial Soap is good for redness-prone or dry skin, and Pumpkin Facial Soap is great for mature skin or dull skin.

settings.title: What is the best natural face soap?
settings.text: Black Clay Facial Soap is a cult-favorite, giving a soft, clean feeling without dryness. It has loads of positive reviews, and works for most skin types.

settings.title: What can I use to clean my face naturally?
settings.text: Cleansing your skin with an Osmia facial soap will remove makeup, sunscreen, and pollution without stripping the skin of moisture or too much oil.

settings.title: What are the benefits of natural facial soap?
settings.text: Osmia’s natural facial soaps remove makeup, sunscreen, and contaminants while leaving the skin soft and clean, but not stripped and dry. They allow your skin to maintain balanced sebum production and proper hydration.

settings.title: Should I wash my face with just water or use soap?
settings.text: A water wash is fine in the mornings, but you should wash with soap before bed to remove makeup, sunscreen, sweat, and contaminants from the skin before sleep.

settings.title: What is facial serum?
settings.text: Osmia facial serums are oil serums, each designed with a different purpose in mind. Balance is for oily, acne-prone, or combination skin; Restore is for dry, damaged skin; Brighten is for dull or dehydrated skin.

settings.title: Can I use facial serum daily?
settings.text: Osmia facial serums may be used daily. They all contain active ingredients at levels that are appropriate for use in a regular routine.

settings.title: Is facial serum necessary?
settings.text: Facial serums can play a critical role in maintaining the moisture and balance of your skin. You can also choose to use Purely Simple Face Cream if you prefer the texture of a lotion over an oil.

settings.title: Who should use facial serum?
settings.text: A facial serum is a great choice for most skin types, except for those with dermatitis or facial eczema, in which case the Purely Simple Face Cream is a better choice, dry, flaky conditions like dermatitis can be exacerbated by pure oils, so a cream is a better choice.

settings.title: How do I use facial serum?
settings.text: Apply your facial serum to damp skin immediately after cleansing by gently pressing the oil into your face and neck. The oil will seal in the moisture from cleansing, and soak in to the deeper layers of the skin where it provides nutrients and fortifies the lipid layer of the skin.

settings.title: Why are Osmia products a great gift?
settings.text: As more people try to live more consciously, Osmia’s commitment to natural ingredients and planting a tree for every single order makes Osmia products a perfect gift for everyone on your list.

settings.title: How to choose the best skin care kit?
settings.text: Each skin care kit has both a description of the skin types it’s best for, and reviews from our customers. Read through both to decide which skin care kit is right for you.

settings.title: Is skincare a good gift?
settings.text: Facial skincare can be fairly personal, but body care products make incredible gifts. From body soap to hand cream to bath products, people love natural skincare in their lives!
In 2012, Dr. Sarah Villafranco redirected her career in emergency medicine to start Osmia, which she sees as a new brand of wellness for your skin, your senses, and the earth.

settings.title: WHO WE ARE
settings.text: Whether your skin is tricky or trouble-free, Osmia offers a natural, joyful journey to your healthiest skin.

Time to help those pesky bumps hit the road! The gentle scrub of Lavender Pine soap is great for daily use, and the Body Buff is your once-a-week hero. Naked Body Mousse brings soothing nourishment for a smoother texture. Safe for use with keratosis pilaris.

Products: Lavender Pine Body Soap, Naked Body Mousse, and Himalayan Body Buff.

Restore Serum, with nourishing shea and kukui oils and a soothing blend of essential oils, like lavender, helichrysum, and blue chamomile, will work to seal in moisture and strengthen the lipid layer of your skin.

Rose Clay Facial Soap and Purely Simple Face Cream work together to help minimize redness, and bring about a feeling of calm for your sensitive prone skin. Safe for use with rosacea.

settings.content: Hi! this little quiz is short and sweet, and will help us match you with a skin kit that is customized for you and your skin.

settings.title: ACNE
settings.text: When it comes to skin that's breaking out, why not try a little tenderness?

settings.pretitle: For decades, dermatologists have treated acne with harsh chemicals and stripping, drying treatments. We have a different idea for your skin.
settings.title: WHAT IS ACNE?
settings.contents: Acne is an inflammatory condition complicated by bacteria and hormones, and each case is unique in the combination of factors that contribute to symptoms on the surface. Inflammation occurs both internally and externally, as a result of diet, stress, and concomitant illness.
